title: lol@post game rating system
body: My ashe carry 14-4-14 gets an A while top lane Garen 8-0-1 gets an S- with 10 more cs. Cough cough Riot!

replies.body:
**It compares the champion you are playing with other people that play that champion in that role.** You have to be in the top x% of people playing Ashe adc (a really common pick right now). 
No point trying to compare your adc score to a top lane garen and asking where your S is.

And how they do the reporting is fucking retarded.

What if I get 4 of the best players, say the top 4 ranked players in the game and go play ARAM or even get 2 of them and go TT? Or just normal SR, I will easily get better stats than someone else on the same champion, easy.

You take a premade team, or even get lucky and get a team with a brain, go into any game mode other than ranked and just get them to let you take all the kills and CS and everything else, free scorecard.

Than you get those solo players who have to compare against that? Sure thing.

>You take a premade team, or even get lucky and get a team with a brain, go into any game mode other than ranked and just get them to let you take all the kills and CS and everything else, free scorecard.

Where is the fun in that? At this point you aren't even really playing the game the way its meant to be played. Nobody that I know uses this method (there are for sure people out there that do though) and yet are all still achieving S grades perfectly fine. Getting one of these grades isn't a constant thing. It's an achievement that means in that game you just played you were in the top x% of players playing that champion in that role. 


>Than you get those solo players who have to compare against that? Sure thing.

Well if you are playing ranked then you have just as much chance as a challenger player playing ranked to get an S grade, even when playing solo. You are with and against players your own skill level and so are they. Even if playing solo in queues where you are going to be with and against players of differing skill levels (norms/TT) if you are playing to improve yourself and have fun, you are still going to get S grades on occasion. 

_**TL:DR** mastery level 6 & 7 are fun to get and because they are performance related, they shouldn't be easy. That being said, if you are getting salty and are losing sight of the main purpose of the game just so you can chase down your tokens, you seriously need to rethink your priorities. _

I'm going to disagree 100% with the mastery level 6-7 though. I've been sitting on lvl 6 mastery on Nami for 5 weeks with no chance in sight of getting 7 because I'm not willing to pay for it and I don't have the luck to get keys or chests when I perform well. Even when I do I don't get the essence or the champ perm to upgrade. On top of that I have 6 other champions that are lvl 5 all with 2 tokens waiting to be upgraded. Yet again can't use em.

>I'm not willing to pay for it 

If you have spare IP, you can buy champ shards in the shop for 1700 IP. 

> I don't have the luck to get keys or chests when I perform well

Chests are a sure thing, provided you or someone in your premade gets an S grade and you are playing a champion you haven't yet received an S on. Head over to the team recruitment page and find some buddies that are keen to play normals. Play for fun though, not to grind and try and cheat the system for S grades. You'll get your chests. 

Keys aren't based on performance (in the typical graded sense), but they are given for wins. [That being said, the key drop rate is non-linear so it does taper off and it can seem like you aren't getting any](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/q/ask-riot-haz-keys-no-haz-bugs-please). It does reset every month though :)
Once again, find some friends and play some ARAM. A nice relaxing mode where the games are shorter and you can still get keys. 

>Even when I do I don't get the essence or the champ perm to upgrade. On top of that I have 6 other champions that are lvl 5 all with 2 tokens waiting to be upgraded.

I'm in the same boat. Remember, its only for aesthetic purposes and no-one actually cares (other than you) if you are a level 5 or a level 7 champion. Everyone understands the struggle for essence. Just believe that you will get there eventually.

If it stand for nothing, than why did Riot implement it in the first place? I get why they are trying, but the fact is, anyone with a little effort and luck can get rank 7 on any champ.

I have just been watching some youtube videos showcasing some REALLY BAD players, some of which have ranks 6 or 7, so yeh, I believe you when you say it means nothing, but again, why did Riot even bother?

It is yet another waste of time they are putting into the game rather than improve the overall game play for everyone.

Yeh but no, you don't stand a chance at getting the same stats or scorecard.

The top tier players are better players for sure, but they also generally do so in premade teams, so no matter if the other players you are against are top tier players or not, you still have a team to help you and that means you can work together easier, therefore you will have a better chance to get better stats than those who are solo.

I am trying to get you guys to understand, premade players have a higher chance to get better stats, therefore, better scorecards regardless of rank or MMR, it is not hard to understand.
Fair enough. I did not know that. I still think it's funny though that the rating system is based on results in other games rather than the game in question. Thx

Not a problem man, yea it was hard to get my head round but eh I see how it works pretty well. Princess Yaia helped me out the first time figuring it out. Any future questions about it. I'd go to Princess Yaia :). Have a good day/night mate
